<script type="text/javascript">
/** @param {jQuery} $ jQuery Object */
!function($, window, document, _undefined)
{
	//Src: XenForo Censor Option
	XenForo.BbmCustOptionListener = function($element) { this.__construct($element); };
	XenForo.BbmCustOptionListener.prototype =
	{
		__construct: function($element)
		{
			$element.one('keypress', $.context(this, 'createChoice'));

			this.$element = $element;
			if (!this.$base)
			{
				this.$base = $element.clone();
			}
		},

		createChoice: function()
		{
			var $new = this.$base.clone(),
				nextCounter = this.$element.parent().children().length + 1; //Add 1

			$new.find('input[name], select[name]').each(function()
			{
				var $this = $(this);
				$this.attr('name', $this.attr('name').replace(/\[(\d+)\]/, '[' + nextCounter + ']'));
			});

			$new.find('*[id]').each(function()
			{
				var $this = $(this);
				$this.removeAttr('id');
				XenForo.uniqueId($this);

				if (XenForo.formCtrl)
				{
					XenForo.formCtrl.clean($this);
				}
			});

			$new.xfInsert('insertAfter', this.$element);

			this.__construct($new);
		}
	};

	// *********************************************************************

	XenForo.register('li.BbmCustOptionListener', 'XenForo.BbmCustOptionListener');

}
(jQuery, this, document);
</script>

How to use options?
> Just use {1}, {2}, etc. inside the replacement ranges
> The replacement accept fallbacks: if a user doesn't set one of the option, a default value will be applied. To use a fallback, use this pattern {1=yourFallback}.
> For security reasons, html tags in fallBacks won't be parsed

Important
Direct replacements are really not recommended if you want to use the options to modify some code. Here's an example to make you understand.In the H2 Bb Code let's say we have this as start range: <h2 style="margin:0;background:{1=none};">
You will have some problem if someone uses this code [h2=red; font-size=80pt]content[h2]. To avoid this, use another method and check options one by one.

If you check this option, any Bb Codes inside the options of an opening tag will be parsed. By default XenForo doesn't support to use Bb Codes inside options.
Example: [bbcode=[b]caption[/b]]content[/bbcode].

To enable them, see here. If you don't want to edit your XenForo file, you can still use the special tags and it will work..

Callback (only for Bb Code with Callback Rendering)

Even if a member doesn't have the permission to use this Bb Code, you can delay the unauthorised return. This means the Bb Code will be parsed in his post during the above interval (starts from the message posted date). Unit is hours. Setting 0 will disable this functionality (for which I have no clue how it could be used - so don't ask ^^).

This option configures which should be the return when the user doesn't have permission to use the Bb Code or if the Bb Code is used outside a post.

If you select the "callback" option, the array $rendererStates will have two new information:
- [isPost]: value is true if the Bb Code is used inside a post, false if not.
- [canUseBbCode]: value is true if the user has the permission to use this Bb Code, false if not or if [isPost] is false.

If you select the "template" option, same thing than above. The array $rendererStates will be modified with those two new values (both in the template and the template Callback).

IMPORTANT: This unauthorised return will only work when the parser is requested. So it will not protect the content of your Bb Code in some forum areas (preview, email, alert, etc.) where the content of the message is displayed in raw format (without the parser).
Template (only for Bb Code with Template rendering)

1. &$content - the content of your Bb Code.
  2. array &$options - the options of your Bb Code put inside an array according to the {link}.
  3. &$templateName - the template name to fetch. If for any reasons you decide to change the template name, don't forget to cache it creating a static function named "preloadTemplates" inside your class (see example here).
  4. &$fallBack - when the page view is not available, your template can't be fetched (ref). The default fallBack is the content of the Bb Code wrapped inside a div tag with this CSS class: template_fallback_{tag}. You can set here a new fallback.
  5. array $rendererStates - rendering options for the XenForo renderer engine.
  6. $parentClass - direct access to the public functions of the parent class (BbCode_Formatter_Base). You should not need to use it here.
Your callback doesn't need to return anything. It allows you to modify on the fly the following variables: $content, $options (array) or $templateName.

Name of the template to fetch. It will be automatically cached.

Three variables are available inside the template:
- {$content}: the content of your Bb Code
- {$options}: (the options of your Bb Code - array)
- {$rendererStates}: (extra information - array)

To access you first option, use this {$options.1}, the second option {$options.2}, etc. You will need to use the raw format for the content ({xen:raw $content}). Same thing for options (ie: {xen:raw $options.1}). Using the "raw" xen tag is safe here. The values are all protected.

Example:
You have created a bbm editor called "Mini Editor" and you want to display it on the thread page (quickreply for posts) & on the conversations page ( (quickreply for conversations). Then you will have to create two configurations:

- one with XenForo_ViewPublic_Conversation_View in the field "View name"
